Comment: I agree that if the electorate is awful (through right wing brainwashing on social media, etc.) then even the most perfect democratic system of governance possible will result in an awful government. Because in democracy the government is not guaranteed to be good, it's guaranteed to reflect the will of the electorate.  However, FPTP is a bad system that results in governments that are less likely to reflect the will of the people. Through gerrymandering the FPTP system can result in an awful government with only a minority of the electorate being awful.  Proportional representation is better than FPTP in creating a government that reflects the electorate.  That said, if nothing is done to stop and reverse the brainwashing that is going on every day on Facebook and Faux News, then sooner or later the American electorate will be majority awful and no democratic system will prevent awful governments.
